data.question: What is the formula of the heterometallic microporous coordination polymer synthesized in the study?
What materials were used in the synthesis of the porous coordination polymer?
What method was used to determine the crystal structure of the synthesized polymer?
What is the role of sodium ions in the porous coordination polymer according to the study?
data.answer: Sodium ions are immobilized on the pore surfaces and act as affinity sites.

data.question: How was the thermal stability of the porous coordination polymer assessed?
data.answer: Through thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) and X-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) measurement.

data.question: What was the observed effect of sodium ions on acetone in the porous coordination polymer?
data.answer: Sodium ions operated as an electron-withdrawing site for the O atom of acetone, indicating Lewis acidic pores.

data.question: What is the significance of the Lewis acidic property of the porous coordination polymer?
data.answer: It indicates the polymer's potential for anisotropic confinement of basic guests around Na(I) sites, useful in material chemistry.

data.question: How does the coordination environment of Na(I) ions contribute to the polymer's adsorption properties?
data.answer: The pentacoordination of Na(I) ions with an open site for guests contributes to the uniform micropores and adsorption properties.

data.question: What does the adsorption isotherm of CO2 on the polymer indicate about its pore structure?
data.answer: The Type I adsorption isotherm confirms the presence of uniform micropores inside the framework.

data.question: How does the synthesis approach contribute to the functionality of the porous coordination polymer?
data.answer: By employing a bifunctional carboxylate/sulfonate ligand, the synthesis approach enables the immobilization of sodium ions on the pore surface, enhancing the polymer's functionality.

data.question: What role does the dabco ligand play in the structure of the porous coordination polymer?
data.answer: Dabco ligands connect the layers of the polymer to build a rigid 3D pillared-layer-type porous structure.

data.question: How does the presence of sodium ions affect the adsorption behavior of benzene in the polymer?
data.answer: Sodium ions facilitate the anisotropic motion of benzene molecules through Lewis acid attractive interaction, affecting the adsorption behavior.

data.question: The synthesis of the porous coordination polymer was carried out under basic conditions using NaOH. True or False?
The porous coordination polymer shows high thermal stability up to 500 °C. True or False?
data.answer: False, it is highly stable up to 330 °C.

data.question: The sodium ions in the polymer are coordinated to two O atoms of the sulfonate group and three O atoms of the monodentate carboxylate groups. True or False?
The total void volume of the polymer without water guests is less than 20%. True or False?
data.answer: False, it is 20.6% per unit volume.

data.question: The adsorption isotherm of acetone on the polymer at 298 K shows Type II uptake. True or False?
data.answer: False, it shows Type I uptake.
